Definition: The title of a collection of recordings issued as a single item on CD, record, or another medium.
The title naming a group of materials with some unifying characteristic, such as the materials assembled by a person, organization, or repository from a variety of sources; an artificial collection.
The title of a single installment of a television or radio series.
The title of a multi-episode asset of limited duration, aired daily or weekly, usually with a total running time of less than 15 hours.
The title of a single asset that has been broadcast on a on a specific occasion.
The title of a self-contained portion of a program/episode, which serves its own function, but operates within the larger program/episode.

The title of a set of episodes broadcast in sequence, usually conceived without a definite end and aired on a regular schedule. Typically all episodes within a single series follow a specific theme or continuous storyline, and are all broadcast under the same series title and branding.
The title of set of episodes that makes up its own series, which is broadcast under an umbrella series with its own branding.
